fields.description:
When jira is deployed in a secure web container and hit using IE 6 the Find Issues page pops up the following warning: 

This page contains both secure and nonsecure items.
Do you want to display the nonsecure items?

It appears to function the same whether Yes or No is choosen.

I can make the popup in IE go away by commenting out the inside of the refreshDynamicMultiIssueTypeOptions function in issuetypes-search.js file. The actual problem occurs on this line: 

sel2.appendChild(clonedOptions[i].cloneNode(true)); 

I have no idea why IE considers the dynamic object nonsecure, but the appendChild does seems to cause the nonsecure popup problem.
fields.summary: Find Issues Page Pops Up Nonsecure Warning in IE6 when run via httpS (secure)

fields.description: It would be handy if the e-mail creation service could be extended to allow for other fields (e.g. component) and custom fields to be set as part of the service config.  SOAP is probably really the right answer if you need to set more than what is currently allowed but sending an e-mail sure is an easy way for other apps to generate issues without human intervention :)
fields.summary: Allow e-mail issue creation service to set more fields including custom ones

fields.description:
ISSUE SOLVED BY PRESSING Ctrl+F5 

We have yesterday upgraded our JIRA to "Professional Edition, Version: 3.5-#131". I have noted a problem when selecting an issue type. You can find an attachment with a visual impression of the problem. The background-image makes it pretty hard to select the correct issue type. In Internet Explorer the image isn't show at all.
fields.summary: Problem with background-image when selecting an issue type

fields.description:
If you unpack the source distribution, then cd into the 'jira' directory and type 'maven war', you end up with a maven error because it can't find xpp3-1.1.3.4-RC8.jar

I assume it's the same xpp3 jar in this package:
http://www.extreme.indiana.edu/dist/java-repository/xpp3/distributions/xpp3-1.1.3.4.O_all.tgz

...since there are a curiously coincident 8 releases (skipping some letters) there.

It compiled against that jar correctly after pulling it and putting it in ~/.maven/repository/xpp3/xpp3-1.1.3.4-RC8.jar, anyway, but I'd be more comfortable if it built correctly from source.

Flagged as blocker since this does indeed block compilation/installation from source unless you use a sketchy workaround
fields.summary: Jira source version 3.5.1 does not compile due to broken xpp3 dependency

fields.description: The message that the log file has not been parsed on the VCS tab panel is shown even when it has been parsed and there are just no matching commits. There should be a different message for no commits found. Also we should specify which repository the message is for.
fields.summary: The message that the log file has not been parsed on the VCS tab panel is shown even when it has been parsed and there are just no matching commits

fields.description:
Some users need to have external links in Description / Comments to open in new browser window.
Looks like this should be per-user configurable.

*Workaround*
Use the middle-click on your mouse if you have a three-button mouse, ctrl-click on Windows/Unix, or cmd-click on Mac.
fields.summary: external links to open in new window

fields.description: My Jira database was initially created under Jira Professional and Oracle 9, it has since been upgraded to Jira Enterprise 3.5 and Oracle 10i. However, the JIRAISSUE.DESCRIPTION column was never converted from VARCHAR2(4000) to CLOB. A user emailed an issue whose size was approximately 30,000 characters. Jira could not create the issue, however, instead of sending a notification Jira got a null pointer exception. I've attached a portion of the log file showing the issue and the traceback.
fields.summary: No notification sent when issue creation by email fails.
Implement a Release History which allows a user to view a timeline of issues getting added and removed from a release

Cause:
java.lang.ClassCastException
fields.summary: Unable to set default value in Multi User Picker field

fields.description: Our system uses a bunch of custom fields to track things like doc need/release note need, etc.  I find it annoying that in order to turn one of these flags off if an issue is closed with them on, I need to reopen the issue, then change the flag, then reclose the issue.  It would be MUCH better if admins could edit Closed Issues.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to Edit Closed Issues

fields.description: Is there any way to disable issue copying? It's just-another action in the action list, and it makes user interface even more complicated.
fields.summary: need to disable issue copying

fields.description: Before I can disable one of the link types, I'd like to be sure it is not widely used. How can I find issues linked by specific link type?
fields.summary: need to find all issues linked with specific link type

fields.description:
This issues is just some thoughts...

I'm wondering if JIRA is getting slower and slower after new features are being implemented? Or is it just me?

The reason i'm asking is, when i load the dashboard on jira.atlassian.com, the load takes 5-6 seconds! I have nothing configured on this page, everyting is standard. No extra filters (where a count is needed to show the no. of issues) or anything like that and no extra portlets. Like anything else, things was better in the old days, i think jira.atlassian.com was faster back then ;).

Is it JIRA, or just your hardware / lines, that could need an upgrade?

Our JIRA installation still runs with a fine performance, but will it still do that in 2 years? We have a lot of issues and a considerable amount of projects and users.

I would expect a system like JIRA to run with hundreds of thousands of issues, and thousands of projects without performance problems. Is this the case?

Can you tell anything about how much data you've tested JIRA with. Is there a maximum of users, projects, issues, groups and so on that one should be avare of?
fields.summary: Is JIRA getting slower and slower?

fields.description:
When I need to reassign an issue from myself (or someone else) to the person who originally reported the bug, I need to scroll up to the beginning of the list. It is confusing because person's position in the list depends on something which is not directly connected to assigning him an issue.

What if such re-positioning of the assignee become optional, system-level or personal preference of issue editor?
fields.summary: Reporter should appear in Assignees list alphabetically
VersionCFType returns different data types from 3.4 to 3.5

fields.description: Similar to User chooser for user fields, it would be useful to be able to filter users by full name in Adminstration > User Browser.
fields.summary: administration:user browser needs filter by full name
Add Resolve and Next and Close and Next buttons to Resolve Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9367].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 28 July 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your patience. We are happy to communicate that this issue is closed as fixed, and it will be available to you shortly.

As you might have noticed, we have not planned this improvement to be addressed explicitly. But we have discovered that we can close it quite easily as a consequence of architectural work delivered to close JRA-25721.

Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description*

Custom fields which are issue type or project specific are not shown in the issue navigator until the relevant project or issue type is selected (and refreshed via the blue box). This could potentially be a bit confusing for first time users.
fields.summary: Custom Fields Visibility in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
We just created a workflow that we tested for 2-3 days on a test project.

After 2-3 days, we decided to associate that workflow to our projects.

When we try to associate the workflow with two of our biggest projects, JIRA crash systematically and we need to reindex, at least, twice before we are able to retrieve our issues.  

MY BIGGEST CONCERN is about the possibility that we lost something ???  Is there any way to insure we didn't ''loose'' any issues ??

We tried several times and it's always the same problem !

We then decided to associate the workflow with two little projects (project 1 with 74 issues and project 2 with NO issues yet), and we have no problem associating the workflow.

Any ideas ??
fields.summary: Crash while associating a workflow to a project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9363].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. 

This capability is now available using the new "Create project with shared configuration" feature, which was released to all versions of JIRA at the beginning of October 2015 (JIRA 7.0). When creating a new project, simply click the "Create with shared configuration" link in the bottom-left corner of the dialog, choose an existing project, and a new project will be creating that shares the same workflow scheme (and other schemes) of the existing project. [More documentation is available here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/defining-a-project-749382822.html#Definingaproject-createCreatingaproject].

We recognize that this is not exactly the same as setting a workflow scheme as "default". Simplifying project setup, configuration, and maintenance is one of the JIRA team's top priorities right now. We are in the early stages of a big investment in making it easier to get started with a JIRA project and maintain a large number of projects at scale.

We will continue to work in this area and intend to provide more comprehensive support for this in the future.

It's important to understand that we rarely try to implement individual features from jira.atlassian.com, but instead take a holistic look at the problem and use feedback from the comments here and a [dozen other sources|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com] of customer input to solve the core problems.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or feedback.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

We have set up a custom workflow scheme that we'd like to use on all new projects.
We need to specify that this custom scheme should be used by default for new projects -- without explicitly specifying it on Administer Project page.

Alternative solution would be to have Workflow Scheme selector right at the Create Project screen, so that admins have a reminder that it should be specified in some way.
fields.summary: user-defined workflow scheme as default for new projects

fields.description:
I just want to express the disappointment that I feel that the professional version of JIRA does not allow "Default Component Assignees".
My company recently moved from Bugzilla to JIRA and relied on this feature of bugzilla.  It seems to me to be a rather basic feature, that a $2400 issue tracker should have.  When you have a project with 10 or 15 people on it, its a pain in the a** to have to reassign every bug to the appropriate person. I think this is a significant oversight in the feature/license matrix, especially for those of us migrating from bugzilla.

fields.description:
While the JIRA UI does not allow a user to vote for an issue if they have already voted, the user can double lick the 'vote' link. The second request will leave a uncommitted transaction and will leak a db connection. The connection will be left in a thread local however. The same occurs if a user double clicks the unvote link.

Databases usually time out unused connections, so the leaked connection will be closed by the database server and the following will appear in JIRA's log files.

For MySQL:
2006-01-27 13:19:25,174 WARN [core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor] [SQLProcessor.rollback]: SQL Exception while rolling back
 insert. Error was:java.sql.SQLException: No operations allowed after connection closed.
2006-01-27 13:19:25,175 WARN [NoModule] org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor
java.sql.SQLException: No operations allowed after connection closed.
    at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.checkClosed(Connection.java:1842)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.Connection.rollback(Connection.java:4724)
    at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.DelegatingConnection.rollback(DelegatingConnection.java:265)
    at org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.PoolingDataSource$PoolGuardConnectionWrapper.rollback(PoolingDataSource.java:288)
    at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.rollback(SQLProcessor.java:131)
    at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.commit(SQLProcessor.java:114)
    at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.close(SQLProcessor.java:153)
    at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.finalize(SQLProcessor.java:702)
    at java.lang.ref.Finalizer.invokeFinalizeMethod(Native Method)
    at java.lang.ref.Finalizer.runFinalizer(Finalizer.java:83)
    at java.lang.ref.Finalizer.access$100(Finalizer.java:14)
    at java.lang.ref.Finalizer$FinalizerThread.run(Finalizer.java:160)

For PostgreSQL:
2006-02-02 17:47:35.486142500 org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, actionbody, CREATED, actionnum FROM jiraaction WHERE issueid=? AND actiontype=? (can't create statement from closed connection.)
fields.summary: Uncommitted transaction and connection leaked if the user votes for an issue while they have already voted or unvotes if they have not voted.

fields.description:
At the moment, translating Jira requires a tedious search an replace. We need to make it easier for users.

For example:
The fact that each properties file has a different order of properties can make translation a hassle.

For example to translate the word *Resolve* to french you to:

1. Open JiraWebActionSupport.properties
2. Find the key *resolveissue.resolve* (line 1330)
3. Open JiraWebActionSupport_fr.properties
4. Search for key (line 962)
5. Translate

Step 4 could be completely omitted if the key was on the same line for both properties files. It would also make it much easier to see what translations are missing.
fields.summary: Needs to be easier to translate i18n properties files

fields.description:
Hi JIRA,

I'd just like to know where the details of 'Change History' are stored in the database?

The reason I'm asking is because I'm planning to write a SQL query that will tell me which issues were reopened in a particular release/version.

Thanks for the info.


Regards,

Christian

example report in jira-development-kit-3.5 won't run.

fields.description:
Take any user and remove that user from all groups, then go to Administration->User Browser.

Now set the group filter to Jira-Users

The user who was removed from Jira-Users is still being shown in that filtered view. That is wrong.

You should have a group filter option that lets people filter for users who are in no groups and not include them in the jira-users filtered view.
fields.summary: If a user is removed from all groups they are still being shown when viewing all users and filtering by the jira-users group

fields.description:
We have several projects now in our Jira installation.  We would like to use a different priority scheme in one them.  

For example:
Project 1 uses the Jira Defaults
Project 2 uses a different naming convention, icons and descriptions.
fields.summary: Please add Scheme support for Priorities

fields.description: This would be handy, especially if there is no list of saved filters shown on the particular dashboard - (e.g. the saved filters portlet which shows the filter description on mouseover) but even if a filter list is shown somwhere it would be nice not to have to go find the corresponding filter in the list and mouse over it to see the description.
fields.summary: show saved filter portlet should show filter description on mouseover

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9313].
  {panel}

Hi,

it would be very helpful to have some more user data in the user profile, e.g. (and most important for me) a *phone number*.
A generic field 'Further Info' could hold various other data relevant to the environment.

Would be glad to see it in the future,
anton

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9311].
  {panel}

I wish I can configure the assignable list in  every step of a workflow, maybe by group memership.
For example in software development, one step is "user tests", and this people is outside the main development group, so it's  only when in a workflow is in  the "user tests" only this people can be assignable.

thanks

Alvaro Alonso
Bogota, Colombia, (South America)

fields.description:
Hi,
We want to create filter asking for issues creating at days-1, or weeks-1.
So I see the the dates and times fields but if I fill :
Created From -1d To 0d : 2 days are listed : yesterday AND today
and Created From -1d To -1d :  No matching issues found.
How to show ONLY issues created YESTERDAY or another specific day ?

And same thing for -1w ONLY !!!

Thanks.

Components per Issue Type

fields.description:
We're using SCRUM for managing our project and one of the key concepts in tracking the work is that it's ok to increase the estimated time remaining for a task. For some reason Jira doesn't allow a value to the time estimate that's greater than the original estimate.

Please remove the constraint from setting the value to remaining time OR make the constraint configurable.

(I can see the Original Estimate field below and am really tempted to enter five minutes as the original estimate just to prove my point. Leaving it alone though...)
fields.summary: When logging work, estimated time remaining must be able to be more than original estimate
Work Log: number of hours per day must be project-specific setting, NOT global

fields.description:
Cause:
To decide what fields should be present, a *Target Issue Object* is created. This object has its issue type set to the default, regardless of the issue types of the selected issues. So a conflict occurs where the first issue has an issue type different to that of the target issue.

To reproduce:
# Set 'Bug' as default issue type
# Create a custom field in 'Improvement' issue type context
# Search for 'Improvement' issues
# Bulk Edit issues

Looking into incorporating Jeremy's changes for Plugins module loaders.

fields.description:
If JIRA is stopped whilst Lucene is reindexing itself, it may leave a lock file behind. This will cause issue indexing to fail on subsequent startups and they will get errors like 

{noformat}
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Lock obtain timed out: Lock@/usr/prod/jira/atlassian-jira-enterprise-3.4.3-standalone/temp/lucene-9683c976083ae985fecc9c87bdbac47b-commit.lock
	 at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock.obtain(Lock.java:58)
	 at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock$With.run(Lock.java:108)
	 at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.open(IndexReader.java:111)
	 at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader.open(IndexReader.java:95)
	 at com.atlassian.jira.util.LuceneUtils.getIndexReader(LuceneUtils.java:31)
{noformat}

The solution is for the user to stop JIRA, and remove the file before starting JIRA again. 

We should add a Johnson Filter to run this check at startup and give them the appropriate instructions / warning if this occurred.
fields.summary: Add check on startup for Lucene locks that were left behind

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new filter with multiple (> 2) projects selected
# Delete one of the selected projects
Then the filter has no project criteria - ie. project criteria is reset to 'All Projects'

(Note: Tested similarly for Components and Versions criteria but could not reproduce)
fields.summary: Filter's project criteria resets to 'All Projects' if a selected project is deleted
Produce Gannt Chart for project component

fields.description:
In certain systems, we've observed that exceptions like:

{noformat}
2006-02-02 10:59:59,462 ERROR [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Giving up reindex - waited 10 seconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getIndexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:463)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:239)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:211)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:391)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.reindexLinkedIssues(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.createIssueLink(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.LinkExistingIssue.linkIssue(LinkExistingIssue.java:129)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.LinkExistingIssue.doExecute(LinkExistingIssue.java:116)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
{noformat}

gets thrown intermittently.

Some investigations are still needed as to exactly why this the case, but initial tests seems to point to the optimise process taking longer than 10s to complete. This means that certain changes might not be reflected in the index, causing the index to be out of date.

Ideally, indexing should occur in the queue, but until then we need to investigate:

# Is it expected that the optimiser may take longer than 10s? Is the time taken relative to the number of total issues? Or issues since last optimisation?
# Is 10s a sensible wait time? Should it be longer?
# Is an optimisation every 150 issues ideal? Will optimisation be faster with fewer issues?

It would also be beneficial if these time outs were configurable.
fields.summary: Indexing intermittently fails with IndexException

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9295]. {panel} We would like to see custom rendering for user names throughout JIRA. For instance, we have inactive users in our system (members of the inactive-user group). When the name of an inactive user group is displayed, we would like to render them on the screen as Joe user and in email templates as Joe User (disabled) We can manually do this by (example from view_details.jsp) : "> "> It would be optimal that all user rendering either be "macroized" or use a common tag that could be extended once. there appear to be ~100 unique places in which users are rendered - customizing them all doesn't make sense. Making this change would set JIRA up to support better user management by distinguishing between external and internal users, admins etc.
fields.summary: Create extensible rendering for user names (reporter,assignee,lead) etc

fields.description:
Hi,

we're currently evaluating JIRA (currently professional version) to replace mantis as our bugtracking tool. 
With some customers we have created private mantis projects (currently > 30) that we imported to our evaluation installation. 

In order to keep customers data private we need to configure separate Permission Schemes for every customer (as well a Group for every customer company) and connect these with each other.

With this configuration our customers can see only their project - fine. Our developers and supporters on the other hand have access to every customers project - resulting in a huge alphabetically ordered list of available projects on the start page - rendering the short overview boxes for each project (that we love for a single project) useless.

As we expect customer projects to rather grow in numbers, we'd like to know your recommendation how to handle this situation. Is it possible to grant customers access to 'their own and their colleagues' tickets? (as opposed to only their own tickets...)

How'd you handle this? We've seen that the enterprise edition features "Dynamic role-specific permissions" but are not sure if this is something we'd need in this case. Of course we'd like this to be the standard behaviour for issues, not something that is needed to be configured for every single issue.

Whew - this is difficult to write down in a foreign language - I hope you get my problem. Unfortunately Australia and Germany are on opposite sides of the globe - I believe I'd be more comfortable on the phone, but each of us is sleeping while the other party is awake :-)
fields.summary: Configuration questions with multiple projects/customers, private data

fields.description:
The group evaluating issue tracking products for purchase in our organization likes JIRA a lot, but stuck with the issue of "project categories". Categorization is important for us due to many projects of different types, sizes, durations, etc. We find that when searching or creating issues, the current UI is cumbersome and confusing to use if the number and types of projects are many.

Having many projects of different types, sizes, durations, etc. really requires them to be categorized, at least from the UI usability perspective. For example, we have transient/temporary projects as well as code libraries, products, and systems to track. Any entity of the last three types (libraries, products, systems) is issue-tracked, version controlled, and released individually.  

-- Displaying many projects in "Project" list box of issue navigator makes it unnecessarily difficult to use (especially for somebody who is not a power user, taking support calls and logging them). Is it possible to include/configure the "Project Categories" as the first/top filter in Issue Navigator? This would allow only a subset of all projects to be filtered and shown in "Project" list box. When creating a project, JIRA allows associating the project with a project category; therefore the relationship is already available for filtering. 

-- Similarly, is it possible to include/configure the "Project Categories" as the first/top filter in "Create New Issue" page? One could start by specifying project category first and then the specific project?

-- You might consider making these two filter additions configurable (on/off).
fields.summary: Filtering projects by categories during issue creation and search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9292].
{panel}
Hi,

Would it be possible to implement a similar feature to that of Confluence that was recently developed where the drafts are saved at certain intervals so in case of a server crash they could easily be recovered? We have just experienced a crash and the users who lost their work expressed their frustration.

Thank you
Ahmet
h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by third-party browser plugins such as Lazarus Form Recovery that save the form data in a database in the browser.

Google Chrome: [https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/lazarus-form-recovery/loljledaigphbcpfhfmgopdkppkifgno?hl=en]

Mozilla Firefox: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/addon/lazarus-form-recovery/

fields.description:
At the moment plugins are quite fragile as they don't declare dependencies.  If you disable a plugin or module that another depends on, no warns are given and there will more than likely be a crash when plugin is loaded.

If the plugin/module is diasabled after the depending plugin has already been loaded, the plugin should be invalidated.  At the moment, if the plugin has already been loaded they will continue to work because the module is usually cached.  See {{PortletModuleDesciptor.getModule()}}.
fields.summary: Investigate declaring dependencies in plugin descriptors
